clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life Assessment Before and After Essure Removal
clinical_study.official_title: Quality of Life Assessment of Women Undergoing Laparoscopic Removal of Essure System : a Before-and-after Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate quality of life before and after laparoscopic removal of the Essure® system. Women who complain about symptoms attributed to the Essure® device are expected to have an improved quality of life postoperatively.

detailed_description.textblock:
Tubal sterilization is a widely used method of contraception. The hysteroscopic method of sterilization (Essure®; Bayer, Germany) was approved in 2007 in France. Increasing patients reports of complications, such as pain bleeding allergies fatigue or articular pain have raised concerns about the device's safety. Women suffering of alleged complications of the Essure® device ask for surgical removal. But, only few studies have assessed Essure® removal in terms of quality of life. This prospective observational study will be conducted at two academic tertiary care center (Montpellier - Marseille).
Patients : Women requesting surgical management for removal of Essure® for alleged adverse effects.
Assessment tools :
Quality of life (pre-operatively and at 1 and 3 months) Anxiety and depression HAD questionnaire (pre-operatively and 3 months)
Preoperative imaging, procedure characteristics, including the Essure® removal method, operative findings, perioperative complications, histopathologic report, and length of hospital stay will be collected.

primary_outcome.description: Quality of life (SF 36) - Change from baseline score of quality of life at 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: General disorders and anxiety or depression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month before surgery and 3 months after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients carrying Essure®
- Patients requesting surgical removal of Essure®
- Patients with adverse effect
- Being affiliated or benefiting from a French social security system
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with guardianship or curators
